section.p: The weekly demand for the top product of a company is normally divided with an average of 400 pieces and a standard deviation of 50 pieces. For this top product, the company wants to handle a 95% service level, which is the percentage of demand that can be delivered directly from stock. For this purpose, the stock is added up to a certain level at the beginning of the week.

ol.li: Determine for different stock levels, from 450 pieces to 550 pieces and increasing with 10, the corresponding service level.
Draw in a chart the service level against the stock level.
Determine the stock level for a service level of 95%.Calculate first with function NORMSINV the z-score for a probability of 95%.
